result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron M. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.

Defendant shall comply with all treatment recommended by his medical or mental health providers.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall obtain his GED/HSED or adult diploma program through the Medford Adult Academy at the discretion of probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Huber and good time granted. 

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Revoked - sentenced to Co. Jail/HOC

Defendant Aaron M. Brown in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Aaron M. Brown in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty places agreement on the record.  Court questions DE.  Atty Nocco makes statement.  Court imposed 7 months in Taylor County Jail with Huber and good time. 78 days sentence credit.  Court costs reduced to a civil judgment.  ba

Defendant Aaron M. Brown in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Aaron M. Brown in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest to possession of narcotic drugs.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Statement by Attorney Nocco.  Court orders withheld sentence; probation for two years with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; comply with all treatment recommended by his medical or mental health providers; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation at discretion of probation; obtain GED/HSED or diploma through the Medford Adult Diploma program.  - rt
